message: Hey guys would love any feedback on my design for startups post: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2424822

was pretty hard trying to distill lots of design info down into there (would make for a 10 part series easily ha. color theory, typography...) so it was more of a compilation of pointers than a teaching guide
Great post, I wish I had that years ago, would have spared me a lot of pain and suffering :P BTW, please add a tweet this button to your site.

Might be offtopic but I still think that Ivan Gazit's presentation "Design for developers: Making your Frontend Suck" from DjangoCon Europe is the best solid resource to learn the basic skills. Slides: http://www.scribd.com/doc/32311867/Design-for-Developers Video: http://blip.tv/file/3685673
@Stammy nice guide. I'm also a fan of Mark Boulton's A Practical Guide to Designing for the Web :)
Thanks @stammy.  I read that today and then instapapered it, glad I can thank you here tho!
Yep I bookmarked it too, nice article
